intro: Codon royenii, commonly known as the Royal Codon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a tall, leafless stem that bears clusters of these showy blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to bloom reliably in suitable climates.
